message.content: This question requires knowledge about the formation of caves and the components that contribute to the formation of rock formations. One significant component of rock formations in caves is bat urine. Bats are common inhabitants of caves, and their urine contains chemicals that contribute to the formation of unique rock formations over time. Option (A) is a phrase used to mock liberals and not related to the formation of caves. Option (C) references ocean water, which is unrelated to cave formations. Option (D) refers to granite statues, which are man-made and not a component of natural cave formations.
